commitResults.messageTitle: Level-1
added list & add function & print function
created Task class, added 'mark as done' function & 'unmark' function
added todo, deadline & event
edited print statements & added test cases
handle invalid input and incomplete desc errors
delete function, OutOfBoundsException
enum
changed the add task function & updated test cases
save the storage data in hard disk
Stores deadlines and event dates as java.time.LocalDate
commitResults.messageBody:
Stored deadlines and event dates as Strings

Teach chatbot to understand dates instead of just storing them as Strings. Formatted dates are more organised and easier for users to understand.

commitResults.messageTitle: Deadline & Event stores dates as LocalDate. Date is stored and read in yyyy/MM/dd format and printed out to user in "day month year" format.
commitResults.messageBody: Dates are printed as such so that they are easier for users to understand.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extracted out the classes - Ui, Parser, Command, Add Command, Delete Command, Mark Command, Unmark Command, List Command, Bye Command, Formatter
commitResults.messageBody: Encapsulated related codes in one class to follow good OOP practices.

commitResults.messageTitle: Organise classes into appropriate packages.
commitResults.messageBody:
Classes were not organised into packages.

Oragnaising the classes makes the code neater and more maintainable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code for Task, ToDo, Deadline & Event classes.
commitResults.messageBody:
Did not have JUnit tests and was not able to do unit testing.

JUnit tests allow for automated unit testing which is ensures each code works correctly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Package the application as an executable JAR file
commitResults.messageBody:
No JAR file to be distributed.

Package the app as a JAR file so that it can be distributed and users can run the JAR file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments for all classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Some classes and methods do not have JavaDoc comments

Adding JavaDoc comments make it easier for others to understand the code

commitResults.messageTitle: Update the code to follow the specified Java coding standard given for this project
commitResults.messageBody:
Some codes did not comply with the coding standard

Following the coding standard makes the code neater and easier for others to understand.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix checkstyle errors for JavaDoc comments
commitResults.messageBody:
Some comments were not following the coding standard

Following coding standard makes code neater and easier to understand

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix checkstyle errors for Tests
commitResults.messageBody:
Some test codes had checkstyle error

Complying with coding standards make code more readable and easier to maintain

commitResults.messageTitle: Resolve merge conflicts in TaskList
commitResults.messageBody: Merge master with branch-A-CodingStandard which resulted in merge conflits

commitResults.messageTitle: Add find function which allows user to search for a task using a keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
There were no find function before

Adding the find function increases the quality of the program

Let's
* add a find function
* make the find command case insensitive

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadoc comments for Junit tests Run checkstyle tests
commitResults.messageBody:
No javadoc comments for Junit tests

Let's
- add java doc comments for Junit tests
- run checkstyle tests

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement a Graphical User Interface (GUI)
commitResults.messageBody:
Use text-based user interface which is less visually appealing than a GUI

A GUI is more visually appealing and could be more user-friendly

Let's use JavaFx to implement a GUI

commitResults.messageTitle: Use Varargs in Launcher and Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Use String[] and ArrayList which does not accept a flexible number of arguments

Varargs reduces the need for overloading

Let's use varargs where applicable

commitResults.messageTitle: Package the application updated with GUI as an executable JAR file
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a JAR file build using code that implemented Text UI

Packaging the new code that implements GUI to release the latest version
of the application

Let's package the new version of the app as a JAR file
so that it can be distributed and users can run the JAR file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Single Level of Abstraction Principle (SLAP) for Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
Varying levels of abstraction within a code fragment reduces code
readability and makes it harder to maintain code

SLAP is followed to ensure that the level of code abstractions in Parser
is the same

Let's abstract code snippets into functions

so that we can level the abstraction level within a code snippet

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Java assertions to define assumptions about the program state
commitResults.messageBody:
Assumptions not checked

Not checking assumptions could result in bugs and cause program to run
in an undesired way

Let's
- Use assertions to check the program state at different points of
the program
- Check internal invariants and post conditions

Using assertions ensures that assumptions in the code are verified
during run time and that program terminates if a bug is detected
This helps to detect bugs and improve code

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code
commitResults.messageBody:
Some code snippets had varying levels of abstractions.
Some codes unused, some duplicated.

Unifying repeated code, deleting unused code
and maintaining single-level of abstraction in a code segment improves code quality, and makes code easier to maintain.

Let's
* Unify repeated code by abstracting out as functions
* Find and remove unused code
* Maintain single level of abstraction in a code segment

commitResults.messageTitle: Use streams to write data to storage file in hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
For loop use to write string

Streams makes code more sophisticated and easier to read

Let's use streams where applicable

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Refactor code"
Reset data file
Add two more types of find (find tasks with names that partially matches the given keyword and find tasks using dates)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is only one find command that finds tasks with names that
completely matches the given keyword which limits the
functionality of the program.

Adding more ways users can use to find tasks using different
keywords makes program more user-friendly and useful.

To give users more flexibility in searching tasks, let's
* add a findflex command that allows users to find tasks with names that
  partially matches the given keyword
* add a finddate command that helps users find tasks using a date given

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more JUnit tests for Deadline, Event and ToDo Made Task abstract
commitResults.messageBody:
Task not being abstract allows for instantiation of a Task object which
we do not want to allow.

Task made abstract to prevent instantiation
More JUnit tests added to test codes automatically.

Let's
* add more JUnit tests
* make Task abstract

commitResults.messageTitle: Change name and modify phrases used by chat bot
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke chatbot personality is not unique.

Giving chatbot a unique personality differentiates it from other
chatbots and gives users a better experience.

Let's give a unique personality by
* changing the name
* modifying the phrases used by chatbot

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve GUI design for better user experience
commitResults.messageBody:
Simple and plain text box design with no borders and small text
can make it hard to see and differentiate user's and bot's texts.
White background can make application look dull.

Added border and differentiating user's and bot's texts
using different background colors makes it easier for user to
differentiate the texts.
Adding colors also makes the program more fun to use.

To improve user experience, let's
* add borders to the dialog boxes
* add background color to the dialog boxes

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract out a Gui class which is responsible for generating responses to user
commitResults.messageBody:
Without the Gui class, chat bot's responses to users were generated in
different methods, which can lead to inconsistencies.

Abstracting the gui class out prevents inconsistencies and minimise
repetitions.

Let's abstract out the gui class and methods that generate responses to
users.
